top_procedures.description: Removal of plaque and insertion of stents into arteries in one leg, endovascular, accessed through the skin or open procedure
Insertion of intravascular stents in vein, open or accessed through the skin, with radiological supervision and interpretation
Removal of plaque in artery in one leg, endovascular, accessed through the skin or open procedure
Removal of plaque in arteries in one leg, endovascular, accessed through the skin or open procedure
Insertion of needle and/or catheter into dialysis circuit and insertion of stent in dialysis segment, with imaging including radiological supervision and interpretation
Insertion of needle and/or catheter for dialysis
Ultrasound study of arteries and arterial grafts of both legs

Insertion of intravascular stents in artery (except lower extremity, cervical carotid, extracranial vertebral or intrathoracic carotid, intracranial, or coronary), open or accessed through the skin, with radiological supervision and interpretation
Excision of blood clot and/or infusion to dissolve blood clot and balloon dilation of dialysis segment, accessed through the skin, with imaging including radiological supervision and interpretation
Catheter removal of blood clot from dialysis graft, accessed through the skin
Ultrasound scanning of blood flow (outside the brain) on both sides of head and neck
Balloon dilation of narrowed or blocked vein, accessed through the skin
Insertion of needle and/or catheter into dialysis circuit and balloon dilation of dialysis segment, with imaging including radiological supervision and interpretation
Removal of plaque in artery in one leg, endovascular, accessed through the skin or open procedure
Ultrasound study of arteries of both arms and legs
Insertion of stents in artery in one side of groin, endovascular, accessed through the skin or open procedure

Excision of blood clot and/or infusion to dissolve blood clot in dialysis circuit and balloon dilation of dialysis segment, , accessed through the skin, with imaging including radiological supervision and interpretation
Laser destruction of incompetent vein of arm or leg using imaging guidance, accessed through the skin
Balloon dilation of narrowed or blocked upper arm artery, accessed through the skin
Established patient office or other outpatient, visit typically 25 minutes
